message.entry: Solver exception caused the simulation to stall.
Click states in the Solver exception table and observe solver exceptions on the Step size plot.
Identify states that contributed to the majority of solver exceptions or solver exceptions around the paused or stopped time point.
Highlight corresponding blocks in the model. Check the values and units of block parameters.
Examine upstream blocks to identify potential modeling improvements.
If states are logged, select each state and click on States Explorer or Simscape Results Explorer to view the state plot. Look for unexpected behavior in the plots.
Zero crossing caused the simulation to stall.
Click blocks in the Zero crossing table and observe zero crossings on the Step size plot.
Identify blocks that contributed to the majority of zero crossings around the paused or stopped time point.
Highlight each block in the model. Explore the zero crossing setting for the block.
Examine upstream blocks to identify potential modeling improvements.
Solver reset caused the simulation to stall at the paused or stopped time point.
Check the model to see if any continuous blocks are driven by discrete blocks.
Solver profiler found Differential Algebraic Equation (DAE) exceptions.
Rank solver exceptions according by DAE newton iteration exception. Explore states with DAE exceptions in the table.
The ratio of solver resets to solver steps was too large. This caused the simulation to slow down.
Solver profiler detected dense groups of solver exceptions in these regions:
Identify states that contributed to the majority of solver exceptions in these regions.
Solver profiler detected dense groups of zero crossings in these regions:
Identify states that contributed to the majority of zero crossings in these regions.
During simulation, the solver used the maximum step size {0}% of total simulation time.
You can improve the simulation speed.
Increase the maximum step size in the Solver pane of model configuration parameters.
There are states with values less than the absolute tolerance throughout the simulation. These states may not be solved to the specified tolerance.
Explore the states in the States Below Absolute Tolerance table. If these states are not noise, lower the absolute tolerance value to less than these state values.
Setting ''DecoupledContinuousIntegration'' parameter to ''on'' might speed up simulation. Note, simulation results might be slightly different, but still satisfy the tolerance settings.
Max step size determined by the solver is {0},
while the fastest discrete rate that does not impact continuous integration is {0}.
while there is no discrete rate.
Simulation might slow down because of this rate difference.
Set ''DecoupledContinuousIntegration'' parameter to ''on'' by typing set_param(''{0}'', ''DecoupledContinuousIntegration'', ''on'') at the matlab command prompt.
Set ''DecoupledContinuousIntegration'' parameter to ''off'' by typing set_param(''{0}'', ''DecoupledContinuousIntegration'', ''off'') at the matlab command prompt.
Setting ''MinimalZcImpactIntegration'' parameter to ''on'' might speed up simulation. Note, simulation results might be slightly different, but still satisfy the tolerance settings.
A significant drop in step size was seen during the simulation. This may be due to a change in the model dynamics.
Turning on adaptive solver auto option may help speed up the simulation.
Enable adaptive solver auto option using set_param(''{0}'', ''EnableSolverSwitchingAtRunTime'', ''on'', ''EnableSolverSwitchingAuto'', ''on'').
There are zero crossings in the model which might be coupled with continuous integration. Simulation might slow down because of this coupling.

Set ''MinimalZcImpactIntegration'' parameter to ''on'' by set_param(''{0}'', ''MinimalZcImpactIntegration'', ''on'') might improve performance. To get concrete diagnostics to see if it can improve simulation performance, please use Performance Advisor check ''Check zero-crossing impact on continuous integration'' for more information.
Solver profiler found no issues in the model.
Solver Profiler temporarily changed model parameter ''{0}'' value from ''{1}'' to ''{2}'' for profiling, the parameter value will be automatically restored after profiling is complete.
Show step size value over simulation time
Show suggestions that may improve the simulation performance
Show updates to the Jacobian matrix for implicit solvers
Show events that cause the solver to reset its parameters
Show States that are below the Absolute Tolerance
Show states and derivative of states over simulation time
Show zero crossing signal values and event density over simulation time

entry.note: the source block/model that caused reset

message.entry: Solver profiler only supports normal or accelerator mode, consider switching to normal mode for profiling and switch back to the current mode afterwards.
The specified time range is not valid
Not enough data collected. Simulation must run longer to sufficiently profile.
Solver profiler does not support profiling for models without continuous states.
State values are not logged during simulation.
Simscape block state values are not logged during simulation.
The name of the current model does not match with the model name in selected session data:
The profiling data may not be displayed correctly. Open a new Solver Profiler session to continue.
The profiling data may not be processed correctly due to internal error.
Buffer size must be a positive integer.
Start time undefined, it must be a valid number.
Start time must be before end time.
Stop time undefined, it must be a valid number.
Stop time must be after start time.
The model simulation is not in stopped mode. Please stop the existing simulation before profiling again.
The selected mat file is not a Solver Profiler session data or is corrupted.
Model ''{0}'' is not loaded. If it has been saved as a new model, please launch solver profiler from the new model to start profiling.
The selected file is not a solver profiler rule set
Threshold values must be a positive number between 0 and 100
Threshold values must be a positive number
Cannot locate streamed states value mat file
Custom rank for State Explorer can only be m files
Custom rule for Solver Profiler can only be m files
Cannot find the entered file, please enter the absolute path

Large amount of states data are being streamed to disk. The current streamed states file size exceeds {0}GB. The estimated streamed states file size will be {1}GB at the end of simulation. As a result, Solver Profiler may need more time to process states data later. Please consider turn off states logging in Solver Profiler or shorten profiling time span for better performance.
Time must be a numerical array
Maximum number of integration steps to profile
Show Newton/DAE solver exceptions of the selected state
Show all other solver exceptions of the selected state
Explore continuous states. Select "Continuous States" checkbox to enable it.
Send figure to a MATLAB figure window
If simulation hangs or pauses, show suggestions when:
Ratio of solver exceptions to number of steps exceeds
Ratio of zero crossing events to number of steps exceeds
Ratio of solver reset events to number of steps exceeds
Over the entire simulation, show suggestions when:
There are any DAE newton iteration exceptions during simulation
There is coupling between integration and discrete rates/zc
Number of solver exception in one second simulation time exceeds
Number of zero crossing in one second simulation time exceeds
Percentage of steps with max step size exceeds
Please stop or finish current steady state workflow before launching Solver Profiler.
Invalid option value for ''{0}'', option ''{0}'' can only be either "On" or "Off".
Invalid option value for ''{0}'', option ''{0}'' can only be a positive number.
''{0}'' is not in valid session data save location
Solver Profiler is already opened for ''{0}'', please finish the current session before starting a new one.
Highlighting blocks from the Solver Profiler is not supported in MATLAB sessions that do not have a display, such as MATLAB sessions started using the -nodisplay option.
